intro: Thesium nigroperianthum, commonly known as the black-perianth thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Xanthorrhoeaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces dark purple to black flowers, which are typically arranged in spike-like inflorescences. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Thesium nigroperianthum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
